IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF CHESAPEAKE BAY ACADEMY IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS THROUGH ACADEMIC PROGRAMS INDIVIDUALIZED TO ADDRESS THEIR LEARNING DIFFERENCES, EMPOWERING THEM WITH THE SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE NECESSARY FOR SUCCESS IN HIGHER EDUCATION, CAREERS, AND LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF CHESAPEAKE BAY ACADEMY IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS THROUGH ACADEMIC PROGRAMS INDIVIDUALIZED TO ADDRESS THEIR LEARNING DIFFERENCES, EMPOWERING THEM WITH THE SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE NECESSARY FOR SUCCESS IN HIGHER EDUCATION, CAREERS, AND LIFE.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN WITH LEARNING DIFFERENCES IN CLASSES WHICH ALLOW FOR INDIVIDUALIZED INSTRUCTION BASED ON LESSON PLANS AND TEACHING METHODS TAILORED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT WAS ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID.

CBA IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, EXCEPT ON NET INCOME DERIVED FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 513(A) DEFINES AN UNRELATED TRADE OR BUSINESS OF AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION AS ANY TRADE OR BUSINESS WHICH IS NOT SUBSTANTIALLY RELATED TO THE EXERCISE OR PERFORMANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. CURRENTLY CBA HAS NO OBLIGATION FOR ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX. CBA BELIEVES IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

ADS PLACED IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS AND THE YELLOW PAGES INCLUDE A RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY. IN ADDITION, AN ANNUAL PUBLICATION IN THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER OF THE POLICY WILL RUN TO COMPLY WITH REVENUE RULING 75-50.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE ACADEMY AND TRACKED IN THE ACADEMY'S TUITION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
THE BOARD IS AUTHORIZED TO SET THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

OtherNonCashContriTableGrp.Desc: AUCTION ITEMS AND OTHER EVENT GIFTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN PART I THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORITNG THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS, NOT THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF FORM 990 IS GIVEN TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW BEFORE BEING APPROVED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE FOR FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT EACH YEAR. ALL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AS A PART OF THEIR JOB CONTRACT. THE MAJOR AREA THAT IS A PART OF THE EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT IS A COVENANT NOT TO COMPETE OR PERFORM THE SAME TYPE OF WORK WITHIN A CERTAIN RANGE OF AREA WHILE UNDER CONTRACT WITH THE SCHOOL AND ALSO FOR A CERTAIN TIME AFTER TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD IS AUTHORIZED TO SET THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS AUTHORIZED BY THE BOARD TO INCREASE THE SALARIES OF EMPLOYEES. THE BOARD FOLLOWS A POLICY OF INCREASE IN COMPENSATION OF HEAD OF SCHOOL BASED ON AVERAGE INCREASE IN SALARIES OF ALL THE EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL USES PERFORMANCE CRITERIA FOR INCREASES IN EMPLOYEES SALARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL DOES NOT HAVE ANY ARRANGEMENTS TO MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAIALBLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. HOWEVER, THESE DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PARTIES WHO REQUEST THEM.
CHANGE IN INTEREST IN NET ASSETS OF RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION -252,341. BAD DEBT -29,653.
THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FOR SELECTING AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.
